resources: PrivacyBuddy Location Icon Microphone Icon Camera Icon Timeline of when apps used your location in the past %1$d days \n\nClick on an access to get more information Timeline of when apps used your location in the past 24 hours Location usage for Apps you do not see here, do not have any location accesses in the time period shown now Welcome to PrivacyBuddy. This app is a prototype designed to test a built-in OS service created by Tristan Pelgrims and Maxime Bellis for their thesis.\n\nChoose a data file, the app will load into the privacy dashboard with the data you choose.\n\nWe invite you to explore the app as if you are reviewing your own data from the past week. Precise: This means the app accessed the exact location of the device with high accuracy, using GPS or other high-precision location services. Approximate: This means the app accessed the general area of the device. The accuracy can range from several hundred meters to several kilometers, based on Wi-Fi networks, cell towers, and other less precise location sources. Sanctioned: This means the user has specifically allowed and requested this specific location access. Examples include sharing your location on Facebook with a friend, which can occur in the background but is still sanctioned by the user, or initiating a route in Google Maps. Foreground: This occurs when the app accesses your location while you are using the app, but without you allowing it at that specific time. For example, Google Chrome using your exact location for searches while you are actively using the browser. Background: This indicates that the location was accessed without specific permission for this instance and while you were not actively using the app, but still doing something on the phone. An example is the weather app automatically updating its information while you are using your phone for other tasks. Subliminal: This is when the phone accesses your location while you are not actively using the phone, and it is in sleep mode. An example includes the weather app automatically updating its forecast while you are not interacting with your phone. Privacy dashboard Choose app to show LocTimelineActivity Latitude is the north-south position on the Earth\'s surface. Longitude is the east-west position on the Earth\'s surface. Accuracy, measured in meters, indicates the radius of the circle around the accessed location within which your actual location will be. With this accuracy of %1$d meters, the app knows you were in %2$s Speed is measured in meters per second (m/s) and represents the velocity at which the device is moving. Bearing, measured in degrees, indicates the direction of travel. It represents an angle between 0 and 360 degrees, measured clockwise from true north. Altitude, measured in meters. It indicates how high the location is from sea level. Showing accesses in last %1$d days Showing accesses in last 24 hours Location access by Datastream 1, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. \n\n This person was often in Leuven and north of Leuven. Datastream 2, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. \n\n This person is all around Leuven but stays close. Datastream 3, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. \n\n This person was active all around and in Leuven. This person had a high frequency of location accesses done.> You are a tutor of 22 years old based in Leuven. You don\'t really care about privacy and are very active on social media. You have a car and also tutor in the municipalities around Leuven, but most sessions happen in Leuven itself. You study Law, go to classes and enjoy the Leuven nightlife a bit, but you always go to sleep on time and turn on airplane mode. \n\n This is simulated data! Do not make any conclusions based on the amount of accesses or the apps doing them. Datastream 4, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. App ordered by location accesses This is a list of all your apps ordered by the amount of location accesses they did. If an app did not do location accesses they are not featured.
